biography.value:
Often called platinum knights, dragonborn champions of Bahamut might belong to an order that exists to protect the world from evil—and especially from evil dragons. A champion of Bahamut has a distinctive pair of platinum wings and a breath weapon suffused with radiant energy.

Dragonborn Champions

The connection between dragonborn and their draconic ancestors manifests in a variety of ways. Some dragonborn identify with a particular kind of dragon and attempt to emulate such dragons’ attitudes and behavior. Others consider their draconic heritage—chromatic, metallic, or gem—something like a large extended family. But for dragonborn champions, this bond is spiritual as much as biological, and they devote themselves to their divine ancestor. Dragonborn champions advance the cause of their dragon god among draconic creatures and other folk alike.

description.value: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.
Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

The dragonborn makes three Longsword attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 1d10 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage if used with two hands, plus [[/damage 3d8 type=radiant average=true]] damage. The dragonborn can cause the sword to flare with bright light, and the target must succeed on a [[/save con 14 format=long]] or be &Reference[blinded]{blinded} until the start of the dragonborn’s next turn. The sword can flare in this way only once per turn.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The dragonborn touches another creature within 5 feet of it. The target magically regains [[/damage 40 type=heal average=false]] hit points. In addition, all diseases and poisons affecting the target are removed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The dragonborn exhales fiery radiance in a 30-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save dex 15 format=long]], taking [[/damage 8d10 type=radiant average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When the dragonborn uses this action, it can choose up to three creatures in the &Reference[cone]{cone}. These creatures take no damage from the radiance and instead regain [[/damage 4d10 type=heal average=false]] hit points each.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Legendary Resistance (1/Day). If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
